data.title: Heart's Desire (1935)
data.meta_description: Richard Tauber, the great Austrian tenor, features in the story of a singing peasant from a Vienna beer-garden who conquers London, but at a cost...
data.text:
I L<3ve Musicals!

The gloriously voiced Richard Tauber stars here in a rag to riches story where he moves from being a cafe singer for a few pennies to a star with an assured future in opera.

Leonora Corbett plays Frances, the girl who ensnares him (Tauber's real-life wife, Diana Napier, also appears as usual).

Naturally one of Tauber's best known songs, 'You Are My Heart's Delight' appears, and whatever you can say about his acting ability (feeble, at least here) and screen appeal (questionable) he certainly had a beautiful voice and this song is one of the best to showcase it.

The film is otherwise pretty forgettable but would be surpassed the following year by fully fledged opera in his majestical 'Pagliacci' in which he acted the part of Canio.
